flawed_nl_solution:
The first candidate's training will cost 1200 * 3 = $<<1200*3=3060>>3060.
That candidate will make the company 93000 - 42000 - 3060 = $<<93000-42000-3060=47940>>47940 in the first year.
The second candidate's bonus will cost 45000 * 1 / 100 = $<<45000*1/100=450>>450.
That candidate will make the company 92000 - 45000 - 450 = $<<92000-45000-450=46550>>46550 in the first year.
Thus, the first candidate will make the company 47940 - 46550 = $<<47940-46550=1390>>1390 more in the first year.
#### 1390

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 3600, not 3060. It appears two adjacent digits were swapped.
